plugins.name: kofferX - Asset Management and Automations
plugins.description:
ü™Ñ tldr:


kofferX streamlines and automates manual tasks such as Dev <> Design Asset Management, Custom Icons and S3 Handling, Token Management, and Review Processes within Figma. Created by designers and developers who understand the pain of manual work, kofferX simplifies collaboration, allowing you to focus on your craft and create amazing products faster.




ü§î What is kofferX?


At kofferX, we eliminate the manual tasks you dread, streamlining asset and token management to enhance your workflow. We understand that handling assets impacts multiple teams, and we're here to simplify those processes for you.


We realize the chores in handling assets and that just doesn't affect one team, but multiple teams:


  1. Design <> Design: Custom icons and illustrations often require frequent asset requests from your team. kofferX simplifies this process.
  2. Dev <> Dev: S3 management and repetitive campaign banner code updates can be tedious. kofferX streamlines these tasks with code and template automation.
  3. Design <> Growth <> Dev: Collaboration becomes trickier with more stakeholders involved. kofferX ensures effective collaboration and integration, keeping everyone in the loop.



‚ö°Ô∏è What all do we offer?


  1. Create Projects and workspaces with access control
  2. Figma to direct S3 uploads to kofferX, just copy link in your favorite format (WEBP, PNG, JPG, SVG)
  3. Get optimized assets with WEBP format conversion on the go.
  4. Create Asset Collections for your campaigns, custom icons, etc.
  5. Plugin Asset Library is a simple drag <> Drop to your fav asset to Figma canvas, whenever you need. (Imagine your own brand library or icon library across teams!)
  6. Replace Assets with new chagnes anytime over the older ones, or restore your past iterations ;)
  7. Compare and review your old to latest asset changes and log them.
  8. Add Tags and keep track of your assets from Plugin/System.



üòé Why kofferX should be a part of your team?


  1. Seamless Integration: kofferX blends effortlessly into your team's existing workflow, staying invisible while enhancing productivity.
  2. Focus on Productivity: Allows your team to use their everyday tools without disruptions, enabling them to work faster and more efficiently. Say no to chores!
  3. Enhanced Collaboration: Eliminates the need for Gdrive, Slack, and WhatsApp, streamlining communication and processes.
  4. Campaign Power: kofferX optimizes your workflows, helping you stay in the loop and power your campaigns effectively.



We are still early and constantly hearing feedback from our users. We are sure kofferX will keep your team pipelines in check without affecting existing codebase or structure. We will soon release our pricing plan and you will love it more as you use. We have something big coming in line for our users and our commitment to it will solve this hassle between teams to improve design -> delivery processes.

For any queries, we are prompt to reply instantly here: dm.new/kofferX


üõ£Ô∏è Roadmap


  1. Design <> Marketing: Design Reviews and Slack Thread is never ending. Managing Google Drive, Whatsapp, Slack to find design_final_final won't be an issue with kofferX.
  2. Design <> Dev: Exporting assets in webp, and S3 cloud, and then back to codebase with asset link is lot of hassle. This pain gets 10x to make changes and update each thing everytime. Token management is painful story for another day, but know this, we directly sync with your Github and no hefty pricing.


and it goes on and on ü¶Ü...


You can know more about us here: www.kofferx.com
plugins.tagline: Automate manual chores like Asset Management, Token Management and Review process!

plugins.name: BrowserStack Accessibility Design Toolkit (Beta)
plugins.description:
Prevent up to 40% of accessibility issues at the design stage.


BrowserStack Accessibility Design Toolkit is a powerful Figma plugin that helps design teams create accessible products from day one. With automated checks, intelligent suggestions, and component-level scanning, teams can shift-left to ensure accessibility compliance while designing, thus reducing development costs.


Learn more about Accessibility Design Toolkit here


Design Accessible Components


Start with Component Scanner to Bake Accessibility into Your Design System

The Accessibility Design Toolkit plugin scans component variants to help designers embed accessibility from the start. It provides:


  1. A component checklist of mandatory WCAG guidelines
  2. Detection of component states (hover, focus, disabled, etc.)
  3. Best practice guidelines for each component


By baking accessibility into your component library, you can scale accessibility consistently across your design system.


Issue Detection by Spectra‚Ñ¢ Rule Engine


Automated, intelligent accessibility insights‚Äîbuilt into your workflow


The Spectra‚Ñ¢ Rule Engine powers deep accessibility checks across your website and mobile interfaces. Here‚Äôs what it automatically detects and guides you on:


  1. Contrast: Flags insufficient text-background contrast and issues caused by opacity
  2. Headings: Suggests proper heading hierarchy and flags structural issues like multiple H1s
  3. Focus Order: Recommends logical keyboard navigation flow for focusable elements
  4. Image Alt-text: Detects all image assets and checks if alt-text is provided
  5. Landmark: Identifies and suggests usage of semantic landmarks for improved navigation
  6. Touch Target Size: Detects tap targets that fail to meet accessibility size and spacing standards
  7. Vision Simulator: Previews visual experiences for users with impairments such as color blindness


Simplify Design-to-Developer Handoff


As part of both component scanner and layout scanner, the plugin auto-generates guidelines and documentation to streamline handoffs:


  1. Automatic heading and text detection for simplified annotations
  2. Intelligent focus order suggestions to skip manual tagging
  3. Accurate ARIA label recommendations and design specs


---

This plugin is licensed under Figma‚Äôs Terms of Service, unless you have a different agreement with us for Figma Services, and any use of BrowserStack Services is subject to your agreement with BrowserStack.
plugins.tagline: Digital accessibility co-pilot for designers

plugins.name: Responsive Table
plugins.description:
Release Notes: Responsive Table Converter v1.0

We're excited to announce the release of the Responsive Table Converter plugin for Figma! This powerful tool allows you to transform standard web tables into mobile-friendly tables with repeated headers, making your designs more responsive and user-friendly.


Key Features:

Easy Conversion: Quickly convert web tables to mobile-optimized tables with repeated headers.

Improved Readability: Enhance the readability of tables on mobile devices.

Seamless Integration: Works directly within your Figma design workflow.

Efficient Workflow: Save time and ensure consistency in your responsive designs.

Instructions to Use Responsive Table Converter


Design Header Cells:

Create the header cells for your table.

Set a fixed width and height for each header cell.

Arrange the header cells in a horizontal auto layout.


Design Row Cells:

Create the row cells in the same manner as the header cells.

Set a fixed width and height for each row cell.

Arrange the row cells in a horizontal auto layout.


Group Header Cells:

Select all the header cells.

Group them and name the group "Head".


Group Row Cells:

Select all the row cells.

Group them and name the group "Row".


Group the Table:

Select the "Head" and "Row" groups.

Group them together and set the auto layout to vertical.


Repeat the Rows:

Duplicate the "Row" group as many times as needed to create your table rows.


Select the Frame:

Select the frame containing your table.


Use the Plugin:

Run the Responsive Table Converter plugin.

The plugin will convert your table to a mobile-friendly format with repeated header
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly transform tables for seamless mobile viewing.

plugins.name: Figma Variable Macros
plugins.description:
Variable Formula

Ever find yourself needing a bit of magic to implement layout values calculated from design tokens? Wondering how you can maintain your design intent in these situations? Variable Formula is the solution: They enable computation from your design tokens, ensuring your design intent remains steadfast and clear.


Variable Printf

Tired of the exhausting task of documenting design tokens on Figma? Finding it painful to display raw values and maintain synchronization? It's time to bring in a tried-and-true method. Welcome the age-old 'printf' into your Figma workflow, one-click display synchronization of design token values.


https://github.com/malangcat/figma-variable-macros

plugins.name: RGB Color Picker
plugins.description:
An RGB color picker is a tool that allows you to choose a color by adjusting the amount of red, green, and blue light in the mix. RGB stands for Red, Green, and Blue, which are the primary colors of light. By combining these colors in various proportions, you can create a wide range of different colors.


There are two main types of RGB color pickers:


Interactive pickers: These are digital tools that you can use on a computer or mobile device. They typically have a color wheel or sliders that you can use to adjust the red, green, and blue values. The picker will display the resulting color in real-time, allowing you to fine-tune your selection.

Predefined pickers: These are static charts or lists that display a range of RGB color values and their corresponding colors. You can select a color from the chart by finding the one that matches your desired shade.

RGB color pickers are widely used in various applications, including:


Graphic design: For selecting colors for logos, illustrations, and other visual elements.

Web design: To define the colors used for text, backgrounds, and other website elements.

Image editing: To adjust the colors in photos or create digital art.

plugins.name: Resizer
plugins.description:
This plugin empowers you to resize multiple layers by independently setting their width, height, and constraints. Choose between fixed values, relative adjustments to the selected layer or its parent, or select from an expanding list of presets for even more flexibility.


Features

  1. Fixed values: Set specific sizes (e.g., 200).
  2. Relative to self: Use arithmetic operations (e.g., +20, -100, 5x, 1/4) to resize layers relative to their current dimensions.
  3. Relative to parent: Resize using percentages relative to the parent container (e.g., 50%).
  4. Custom options: Tailor resizing to fit unique scenarios.
  5. Familiar presets: Quickly apply predefined size options without taking your hands off the keyboard.


Custom Options

  1. Preserve width/height: Modify only one dimension.
  2. Lock aspect ratio: Adjust size while maintaining proportions.
  3. Mirror height/width: Change the orientation or inherit the opposite parameter.
  4. Fill width/height: Instantly fill the parent container.
  5. Stretch top/right/bottom/left: Resize to touch the parent container's boundaries.
  6. Minimum/Maximum among selection: Automatically set size to the smallest or largest dimension in the selection.


Known Issues

  1. Resize behavior may be unpredictable. Let me know your expectations in the comments!
  2. Search might not return expected results if you skip characters.
  3. You cannot use 0px values due to a limitation of the Figma API.
  4. The "Learn more" action is not available, yet.
  5. Some FigJam layers do not support resizing, and since the notification system is currently minimal, these layers are ignored without clear communication through the UI.


Future plans

I‚Äôm working on these updates based on your feedback. Your support, through comments, likes, or sharing, helps make these possible!

  1. Variable support: Set dimension-scoped variables for even more flexibility.
  2. Custom presets: Define your own presets.
  3. Anchor control: Adjust resizing behavior by choosing between center, top, right, bottom, or left anchor points.
  4. Improved search: Enhance search to handle cases where characters are skipped.
  5. Improved notifications: Enhance the response clarity after resizing.
plugins.tagline: Resize multiple layers instantly with fixed, relative, or custom options.

plugins.name: Easy QR
plugins.description:
Easy QR for Figma - Simplifying QR Code Design


Elevate your Figma experience with Easy QR, a dynamic plugin leveraging the powerful QR Code Styling library. Effortlessly generate QR codes as SVG and PNG directly within Figma, offering unparalleled flexibility and customization.


Key Features:


SVG and PNG Output: Generate QR codes in scalable SVG or high-resolution PNG formats, seamlessly integrating them into your Figma projects.


Customization Options:


  • Shapes and Colors: Modify QR code shapes and colors to align with your design aesthetic.
  • Logo Integration: Add logos to personalize QR codes, enhancing brand recognition.
  • Background Options: Choose between backgrounds or go for a clean, transparent look.
  • Correction Level: Ensure optimal scan performance by adjusting the error correction level to meet your specific requirements.


Trial Period:

Enjoy a 7-day trial of Easy QR, exploring its full range of features at no cost.


Activation:

After the trial period, a one-time payment of $10 is required to activate Easy QR. Please note that local taxes may apply to the payment.


How to Get Started:


  • Install Easy QR from the Figma plugin library.
  • Generate QR codes with ease directly within your Figma workspace.
  • Customize shapes, colors, logos, and more to suit your design needs.
  • Experience the convenience of QR code creation and modification without leaving Figma.


Enhance Your Workflow:


Whether you're designing marketing materials, product packaging, or interactive presentations, Easy QR streamlines the QR code creation process, empowering you to create visually appealing and functional designs effortlessly.


Upgrade Today:

Unlock the full potential of QR code customization with Easy QR. Try the 7-day trial and seamlessly transition to the full version with a one-time payment of $10. (Local taxes may apply.)


Note: Easy QR is designed for Figma and built on the QR Code Styling library to ensure reliability and efficiency in QR code generation.
plugins.tagline: Unlimted QR possibilities

plugins.name: Codyhouse Color Importer
plugins.description:
Import your colors from Codyhouse to Figma like never before!


Features:

This plugin can:

  • Import colors from Codyhouse: UI Framework -> Globals -> Colors
  • Create "color sample" circles from imported color
  • Split color to themes



How to use?

  1. Open Codyhouse and go to color editor (UI Framework -> Globals -> Colors).
  2. Create your color system and test this.
  3. Click to Copy SCSS
  4. Open Figma and run this plugin.
  5. Paste your SCSS code in textarea.
  6. Click to Generate Color.
  7. And "Voila!)" You have imported colors into your color schemes!


Contacts:

  • Email: me@jagk.ru
  • Website: jagk.ru
  • Repository: GitHub
  • My GitHub: @jag-k

plugins.name: Design Asset ProductionÔºàDAPÔºâ
plugins.description:
Introduction:

Obtain all solid color style data with one click and save it to variables in Figma.

Main functions:

Simple and easy to use: users only need to click the button of the plug-in to complete the query and export of color styles.

Method of use:

  1. Open the Figma document.
  2. Install and run the plug-in (Design Asset Production(DAP)).
  3. Click the "colors style to Variable" button in the plug-in interface.
  4. The plug-in will automatically get the solid color style and add the name and color value to the variable.
  5. The query and export results are saved in variables in the plug-in and are available to the user at any time.

About the Author:

Hello everyone, my English name is Cheung, Chinese name is Gong Chang Zhang, I am an Internet experience designer.

I love‚ù§Figma also uses a large number of plug-ins at ordinary times, but I find that there are always some needs that cannot meet my needs, so I hope to make a plug-in to satisfy myself, and I don't like to switch plug-ins frequently. I hope the plug-in is in a permanent open state to meet my efficient operation.

This is my first time to learn code compilation to develop plug-ins. Maybe plug-ins are relatively simple because I am still learning to develop them.üòÇ, the development progress will be slower, but I believe this plug-in can satisfy more people, welcomeüëèEveryone to use!

I also hope that some developers will help me make more creative functions to reduce the working time of designers and developers.

Update log:

NEW

wSupport for user-defined variable collection names

Optimization

Prompt for successful variable creation

Create failed without closing plug-in

  • Successfully created without closing the plug-in


Follow-up planning

At present, it is only the first version, with only variable-related content. In the future, more functions of variables and functions to improve efficiency when making components will be added one after another. The future plan is as follows:

Maintaining binding to styles when importing variables, breaking binding of styles to variables, synchronizing styles to variables, etc.

More variable support

Efficiency-enhancing features when making components

Note:

At present, it is only the first version, and more functions will be added one after another in the future.

Maintain associations with styles when importing variables

More variable support

Limited by this time node, the variable support of figma is still very limited, and I will keep the plug-in updated all the time.

If you have any suggestions or ideas in the process of using it, please leave a message in the comment area and I will reply as soon as possible.

At present, the icon and cover of the plug-in have not been designed. If you are interested or have ideas or suggestions, please contact me

My email: vividzyl@gmail.com

62542.name: Design Asset ProductionÔºàDAPÔºâ
62542.description:
Introduction:

Obtain all solid color style data with one click and save it to variables in Figma.

Main functions:

Simple and easy to use: users only need to click the button of the plug-in to complete the query and export of color styles.

Method of use:

  1. Open the Figma document.
  2. Install and run the plug-in (Design Asset Production(DAP)).
  3. Click the "colors style to Variable" button in the plug-in interface.
  4. The plug-in will automatically get the solid color style and add the name and color value to the variable.
  5. The query and export results are saved in variables in the plug-in and are available to the user at any time.

About the Author:

Hello everyone, my English name is Cheung, Chinese name is Gong Chang Zhang, I am an Internet experience designer.

I love‚ù§Figma also uses a large number of plug-ins at ordinary times, but I find that there are always some needs that cannot meet my needs, so I hope to make a plug-in to satisfy myself, and I don't like to switch plug-ins frequently. I hope the plug-in is in a permanent open state to meet my efficient operation.

This is my first time to learn code compilation to develop plug-ins. Maybe plug-ins are relatively simple because I am still learning to develop them.üòÇ, the development progress will be slower, but I believe this plug-in can satisfy more people, welcomeüëèEveryone to use!

I also hope that some developers will help me make more creative functions to reduce the working time of designers and developers.

Update log:

NEW

wSupport for user-defined variable collection names

Optimization

Prompt for successful variable creation

Create failed without closing plug-in

  • Successfully created without closing the plug-in


Follow-up planning

At present, it is only the first version, with only variable-related content. In the future, more functions of variables and functions to improve efficiency when making components will be added one after another. The future plan is as follows:

Maintaining binding to styles when importing variables, breaking binding of styles to variables, synchronizing styles to variables, etc.

More variable support

Efficiency-enhancing features when making components

Note:

At present, it is only the first version, and more functions will be added one after another in the future.

Maintain associations with styles when importing variables

More variable support

Limited by this time node, the variable support of figma is still very limited, and I will keep the plug-in updated all the time.

If you have any suggestions or ideas in the process of using it, please leave a message in the comment area and I will reply as soon as possible.

At present, the icon and cover of the plug-in have not been designed. If you are interested or have ideas or suggestions, please contact me

My email: vividzyl@gmail.com

plugins.name: Perceptual Color Adjustment
plugins.description:
Stay in the creative flow by making immediate perceptual color adjustments to any selection in real-time!

üåà

Most color tools I have used take you "out of flow" because they're overly complicated to use. I wanted something that was much more free with results that were immediate. I wrote this plugin to enable "immediacy" that keeps creatives in their flow, and allows quick generative and iterative design.

üåà

Works on all layer types that support color or images!

Change the color of:

  1. Fills (all types including image fills)
  2. Strokes
  3. Effects
  4. Text and text ranges
  5. Images (turn on in settings)
  6. Illustrations

üåà

You can also insert starter templates onto the Figma canvas at the click of a button, there are currently two:

  1. Create Color Wheel ‚Äî Create a perceptually uniform color wheel that has 360 hues that you can easily adjust with the plugin
  2. Create Color Scale ‚Äî Create a Color Scale based on perceptual luminance. Start here and adjust to create beautiful color themes for your design.

üåà

plugins.name: Image Brightness Analyzer
plugins.description:
Enhance the readability of your images with the Brightness Analyzer plugin. This tool calculates the average brightness of any image, providing recommendations for optimal overlay use to ensure your text stands out. Whether you‚Äôre designing for web, print, or social media, this plugin helps you achieve perfect contrast for maximum legibility.


üåû Features


  1. Accurate Brightness Calculation: Uses an algorithm to determine the average brightness of your images.
  2. Overlay Recommendations: Suggests the best overlay color and opacity to improve text readability.
  3. User-Friendly Interface: Simple, intuitive design for quick and efficient use.
  4. Seamless Integration: Works flawlessly within your Figma workflow.


üöÄ Usage Instructions


  1. Upload your image to the plugin.
  2. Instantly receive the average brightness percentage.
  3. Get recommendations for the best overlay to use.
  4. Apply the suggested overlay to enhance text visibility.


Why Use Brightness Analyzer?


Ensuring your text is readable over images can be challenging. The Brightness Analyzer plugin simplifies this process by providing you with clear, actionable recommendations based on the brightness of your image. Say goodbye to guesswork and ensure your designs always have the perfect contrast.


Made with üåû by Rodolphe
plugins.tagline: Optimize your image's readability

plugins.name: Octopus.do to Figma by Vizioz
plugins.description:
Simplify your design workflow with the Octopus.do to Figma wireframe importing plugin from Vizioz. This plugin allows you to import wireframe designs from Octopus.do directly into Figma, transforming lo-fi wireframe diagrams into fully realized Figma designs.


Key Features

Effortless Import: Quickly bring your Octopus.do wireframes into Figma with just a few clicks.

Auto-Matching: The plugin automatically matches Octopus.do wireframe components to your pre-created Figma designs, saving you time and effort.

Customizable Grid: Create a grid of frames for each wireframe component from Octopus.do, enabling you to design your own Figma wireframe blocks for future imports.


Why Use Octopus.do to Figma Wireframe Importer?

  1. Streamline your design process by integrating wireframes from Octopus.do directly into Figma.
  2. Save time with the automatic matching of wireframe components to Figma designs.
  3. Customize and organize your wireframe blocks for easier and more efficient design work.


Transform your wireframes into polished designs effortlessly with the "Octopus.do to Figma by Vizioz" plugin. Try it today and elevate your design workflow!


Documentation

Please read the documentation :)


Have any feedback or issues?

Feel free to contact me via Discord or on X ( formally Twitter )

  5. Export creative work back to Air

plugins.name: Word Hugger
plugins.description:
Word Hugger scans all the text elements on the current Figma page, identifying and adjusting paragraphs that end with short, isolated words ‚Äì commonly referred to as "orphans." By converting the space before these orphans into a non-breaking space, the code ensures that these words are not isolated at the end of a paragraph.


In typography, an orphan is a single word at the end of a paragraph. Orphans can disrupt the visual rhythm and balance of a page, making the layout appear uneven and possibly hindering readability. Adjusting them ensures a more aesthetically pleasing and cohesive presentation of text, offering readers a smoother experience.
plugins.tagline: Every word deserves company.

plugins.name: Polipo ‚Äî Keep Figma and product synchronized, in real time.
plugins.description:
Complex designs, happy developers.


Implement any design in just a few lines of code.

Keep Figma and product synchronized, in real-time.


Works with: Figma, React, Next.js, Remix, Gatsby, HTML5 and CSS3.


Go to polipo.io to learn about Polipo and book a demo, or watch our video.


The 1st Figma Compiler

Polipo runs on the developer‚Äôs computer and compiles Figma designs instantly into HTML and responsive CSS, rendered via React.


Here is how to use Polipo:


1. Create a design

Design a screen or component, with a single or multiple variants


2. Connect it to code

Customize responsiveness, sizing, hover states, and more


3. Add logic with React

Add custom tags, attributes, event listeners or dynamic data


4. Develop and iterate

Design changes are reflected in the product instantly


5. Build for production

Export everything from Figma without leaving the command line


6. Your product is live

Deploy optimized and responsive HTML/CSS with your React logic


Web development, just great

Deliver sooner, keeping both designers and developers engaged.

Get the best out of your team.


Real-time Figma Synchronization

Preview design changes instantly in your browser, thanks to our real-time Figma synchronization. Every adjustment in Figma is reflected in your web application in less than 1s, making collaboration truly seamless.


Single Source of Truth

Polipo ensures that your design and your product stay perfectly aligned. Figma becomes the single source of truth for layouts and visual, while code stays the single source of truth for interactions, data flow and logic. You no longer have to worry about outdated components or conflicting versions.


No Generated Code

Polipo isn‚Äôt a code generator ‚Äì it‚Äôs a compiler. It takes Figma designs along with your handcrafted code to produce optimized HTML and CSS on the fly. Say goodbye to maintaining mountains of auto-generated code, and focus on what really matters.


Launch Today, not in Months

Turn a complex design into a live application in just a few seconds. You can go from design to deployment in a single day, launching products that are visually stunning and completely on-brand ‚Äì without months-long delays.


Seamless Collaboration

Designers and developers work together from day one. No more time-consuming hand-offs: every update made in Figma can be automatically synchronized with your product, allowing both teams to iterate without friction.


Loved by Developers

Polipo puts developers in control. Specify exactly which elements to extract from Figma and how to make them dynamic, and export optimized code right from the command line. Developers retain the flexibility to tweak and customize every detail.


Pixel-perfect, effortlessly.

With Polipo, even the most intricate designs are rendered exactly as intended, without disrupting your codebase. Designers no longer need to compromise their vision to meet development requirements, and can just focus on creating stunning designs.


Responsive by Design

Responsiveness is crafted directly in Figma. Designers can use auto-layout, variants, variables, and breakpoints to ensure their designs adapt beautifully across all screen sizes. Polipo automatically compiles this logic into a unified markup and responsive CSS.


Focus on Logic, not Pixels

Developers can focus on the core logic and business-critical functionality of your applications, without getting bogged down in design details. Polipo handles the pixel-perfect translation, leaving you to concentrate on the data and interactions.


Predictable and Reliable

Polipo‚Äôs algorithm guarantees accuracy. It doesn‚Äôt rely on AI, so you can trust it to generate correct, optimized code every single time. It‚Äôs designed to run locally and quickly, giving developers full control over the process while ensuring a reliable output.


Keep your Data Safe

Polipo runs entirely on your local machine, meaning your design files and code never leave your environment. This ensures complete control and protection of your sensitive data. Ideal for enterprises requiring high levels of security and compliance.


Flexible for Any Project

Whether you're building a landing page, an e-commerce platform, or a complex enterprise application, Polipo speeds up your workflow, helping you deliver faster without compromising quality.


Simple pricing for everyone

Polipo doubles the productivity of your team, at a fixed price.

Go to polipo.io to check our pricing.


Frequently Asked Questions

Here are the answers to the most common questions from our clients.


What is the quality of the compiled code?

Polipo compiles efficient markup and CSS, optimizing the HTML by removing duplicates and redundant elements, even when components have multiple variants in Figma. The compiled CSS uses selectors and media queries effectively, adapting the design to different screen sizes, color schemes, hover states, and more. Since Polipo focuses on producing target code ‚Äî not source code ‚Äî there's no need for you to maintain it, allowing us to prioritize speed and accuracy.


What about responsive design?

Responsiveness is built directly into Figma using auto-layout, breakpoints, and variants. Developers can refine responsiveness further with custom CSS when needed.


What happens in production?

To deploy for staging or production, the compiled markup and CSS are exported and added to your codebase via Git. In production mode, there is no longer any connection to Figma or Polipo, same as a traditional code-based implementation. New design changes in Figma are not automatically reflected in production until they are deployed by a developer.


What are people building with Polipo?

Polipo can be used for all web-based products based on Figma designs. Our most common use case is building marketing and e-commerce websites with a high level of customization and dynamic or CMS-provided data. The most common framework used with Polipo is Next.js.


Can I use it for prototyping?

Yes! Polipo makes prototyping faster by quickly turning your designs into live applications. You can use the prototype as a foundation for your final product or switch to a traditional development approach later, depending on your needs.


What is the runtime overhead?

None. The generation of markup and CSS happens at build time. In production, markup is rendered via a direct translation to JSX, with negligible runtime cost.


Is it optimized for SEO?

Yes. Polipo gives developers full control over SEO by allowing them to customize semantic markup, including tag names and attributes.


What about workflow, CI/CD, and versioning?

Figma designs are treated like traditional assets (images, SVGs, fonts, etc.). Compiled markup and CSS are versioned in Git alongside your application code and can be processed by CI/CD pipelines. Figma files themselves can be managed through native Figma branching and versioning or with a manual workflow.


Does it use AI?

No, our code generation is completely procedural.


Which frameworks do you support?

We support React, Next.js, Remix, and Gatsby. We also have preview versions for Vue.js and Angular, supported on a project-by-project basis.


Do you provide support?

Yes, we offer dedicated support for teams. Contact our sales team to learn more about our support options.


Need to move fast?

Go to polipo.io and book a demo or watch our video.

plugins.name: Variable Doc

Simplify your Figma workflow with Variable Doc ‚Äî the ultimate tool for managing and documenting your variables effortlessly.

Whether you're working with local variables or shared library variables, this plugin provides a seamless way to view, filter, and organize everything in one place.


All Your Variables, One View

Easily access a clear and organized overview of all your Figma variables, including both local and library variables, without navigating through multiple menus.


Search and Filter by Type

Quickly find the variables you need with intuitive search and filter options. Filter by type ‚Äî Color, Number, String, or Boolean ‚Äî to keep your workflow efficient and focused.


One-Click Documentation

Choose from 3 distinct styles, all designed with Auto Layout for a polished and organized presentation. Perfect for sharing with your team or clients, ensuring everyone stays on the same page.


Eliminate hours of manual work by automating variable management and documentation. Spend less time organizing and more time designing!


Enjoy using Variable Doc, and if you encounter any issues or have questions, feel free to reach out via email.

plugins.tagline: Quickly view all your Figma variables at a glance and document them instantly with one click!

108891.name: Variable Doc
108891.description:
Simplify your Figma workflow with Variable Doc ‚Äî the ultimate tool for managing and documenting your variables effortlessly.

Whether you're working with local variables or shared library variables, this plugin provides a seamless way to view, filter, and organize everything in one place.


All Your Variables, One View

Easily access a clear and organized overview of all your Figma variables, including both local and library variables, without navigating through multiple menus.


Search and Filter by Type

Quickly find the variables you need with intuitive search and filter options. Filter by type ‚Äî Color, Number, String, or Boolean ‚Äî to keep your workflow efficient and focused.


One-Click Documentation

Choose from 3 distinct styles, all designed with Auto Layout for a polished and organized presentation. Perfect for sharing with your team or clients, ensuring everyone stays on the same page.


Eliminate hours of manual work by automating variable management and documentation. Spend less time organizing and more time designing!


Enjoy using Variable Doc, and if you encounter any issues or have questions, feel free to reach out via email.


Currently, this is the beta release of version 1.0. We're actively working on fixing minor bugs and planning to add exciting new features in the near future. Stay tuned for updates!

plugins.name: Hex2Tailwind
plugins.description:
Seamlessly pick one or multiple colors and effortlessly convert them into Tailwind's vibrant color palette. Unlock a world of design possibilities with ease and efficiency.


With a simple click, effortlessly choose one or multiple colors and witness the magic as they seamlessly transform into Tailwind's versatile and eye-catching color palette. Gone are the days of manually searching for the perfect hues that align with Tailwind's extensive range of colors. Our plugin does the heavy lifting for you, saving valuable time and energy.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly select and convert colors to Tailwind's versatile color palette with Hex2Tailwind.

plugins.name: Custom Sticky Color
plugins.description: You can change the color of one sticky note or a group of sticky notes to any hex color you want. Just select the sticky note(s) you want to change the color of, run the plugin, select the color you want from the list, or pick a color that's not in the list from the color picker.
plugins.tagline: Change sticky notes to any color

plugins.name: Display for role
plugins.description:
A plugin that allows managing roles by show-hide function


Prerequisites:

  • Add _roles page to your Figma file
  • Add a list of nodes with the names of your roles on _roles page
  • Plugin will automatically find this list and you can apply them to elements you want
  • Select the parent frame or group and then select the role and click show
plugins.tagline: Visibility management for elements in your UI
